result.execSummary:
The defendant Pablo Rivas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 12 years 7 months bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 06-23-2022:  Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP after serving 7.5 years.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Learn to write in Spanish or English.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

DNA sample.
CFTS.

Defendant Pablo Rivas appeared in court, in custody  Atty Johnson Cabranes appeared .  Interpreter Alberto Aguilar provided interpreter services for defendant and co-defendant, Alma Mendez-Michel.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.  
Atty Heather Johnson in court with Mr Rivas' other file, (17CF787).  No action being taken on this case today.
Voluminous briefs have been received.
Question as to if defendants were transported to police department prior to discovery of drugs or were still at the scene.  Per Ms Riek, the police officer has indicated the defendants were transported to police department after discovery of drugs.  Court will proceed under the assumption that the defendants were transported after drugs located.
Mendez-Michel motion to dismiss -- 
BTC:  Information provided at preliminary hearing found to be not credible.  Critical information was omitted from criminal complaint.  Discovery compliance to the defense and the Court was ignored.  Motion to dismiss denied.
Motion re stop and detention -- 
BTC:  original stop valid and reasonable.  
Court finds defendants not transported prior to discovery of drugs.
K9 sniff -- 
Ms Michel did not establish standing; Mr Rivas did have standing as driver of the vehicle
Merits of search - legal cause found for search
Motions challenging search denied.
Written decision to follow on motion on outrageous conduct to be provided by 08/18/17.  Parties to notify the Court re transport  by 08/16/17
Mr Rivas' case to be tried first

Defendant Alma B Mendez-Michel in court with attorney Catharine O'Daniel.  Defendant Alma B Mendez-Michel in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Interpreters Daniel Lopez, Alberto Aguilar, Ruth Garcia are sworn by the Court. Attorney O'Daniel and Attorney Cabranes have received the letter and records mailed by Ms. Riek on June 27. The State calls Officer Steven Beal - DSAT. Cross by Ms. O'Daniel for the defense. Defense marks Ex #19-Certificate/Diploma of K-9 Odin. Defense marks Ex #20-report of Officer Beal and #21-Photo of glove box area. Defense moves Ex #21 into evidence/received. Re-direct by the State. The State recalls Officer Juan Garcia - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross exam by Ms. O'Daniel for the defense. Cross xam by Atty Cabranes for Mr. Rivas/defense. State rests. Ms. O'Daniel offers Officer Nuttall's report and the email chain between parties indicating there is a statement - singular - rather than statements as offer of proof. The Court accepts the email and marks same as Ex #22/received. All parties rest. 

Defense is asking for transcripts of hearings and ask for copies of transcripts to be received/reviewed a week prior to brief's being due. Ms. Shue indicates she can have transcripts done w/in a week

BTC: Transcripts are to be distributed to parties by next parties. Parties are to do simultaneous exchange of briefs 10 days after that. Brief responses to same are due the end of the same week they are exchanged. The Court wants legal authority on an officer allowing a dog into a car
#15-Photo
Motion hearing on July 6, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Pablo  Rivas in court with attorney John Alexander Cabranes.  Defendant Pablo  Rivas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
  Interpreter, Rick Kissell, appeared on behalf of the defendant. Interpreter is sworn. Ms. O'Daniel indicates she did not receive the field performance records for the K-9/officer as requested by the State and asks for leave to recall the K-9 officer once she does receive those records. The Court orders the State to produce such records if they are able. Interpreter Elke Luken is sworn by the Court. State calls Officer Michael Seeger - DSAT. Direct by State. State marks Ex #14-call log & records check of occupants of vehicle. Interpreter Olivia Alfaro is sworn by the Court. The State asks that the Court take judicial notice of 15CF1505. State marks Ex #15-photo of tint meter reading. Cross xam by Ms. McDaniel for the defense. Defense marks Ex #16-Officer Seeger incident report. Defense marks Ex #17-User manual for Enforcer II tint meter. Cross exam by Atty Cabranes for defense. The State has been granted leave to show the video, foundation has been stipulated to. Ms. Riek marks Ex #9-DVD of traffic stop-received/published. Cross exam by Ms. O'Daniel. Defense marks Ex #18-copy of identifying information for Ms. Mendez-Michel. Cross xam by Mr. Cabranes.
The State has provided the field perfomance records of the K-9 and the Court will receive the testimony of Officer Beal and reserves the issue of the reliability of the dog. State calls Officer Stephen Beal - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by Ms. O'Daniel. Officer Beal is to provide any other certificates for K-9 Odin as soon as possible so defense can review the information prior to the next hearing.

State moves for admission of all exhibits

BTC: Take argument on 7-6 and the Court will allow a simultaneous exchange of written authority one week prior

Defendant Pablo  Rivas in court with attorney John Alexander Cabranes.  Defendant Pablo  Rivas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Interpreter: Elke Luken. 

BTC: The Court is satisfied that the CI/CI's could offer testimony that would be probative. The Court is satisfied that the CI/CI's would have nothing to say that would be reasonably exculpatory on the merits or credibility. The Court believes the CI/CI's testimony would be inculpatory.  The Court declines to disclose the identity of the CI/CI's. Mr. Rivas did not make a showing that entitles him to an in camera review.

State calls Inv. Juan Garcia - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #9-DVD of stop. Cross by Atty O'Daniel for the defense. Cross xam by Atty Cabranes for defense. State calls Inv. Don Nuttall - DSAT. Direct by State. Cross xam by Atty O'Daniel. Cross xam by Atty Cabranes. State calls Sgt. Robert Thilleman - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by Atty O'Daniel. Atty O'Daniel. Cross by Atty Cabranes. The State calls former Inv. Mark Sorensen - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Atty O'Daniel. Cross xam by Atty Cabranes.
Ex #1 & 2: Photos

Defendant Alma B Mendez-Michel in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty as sponsor for Ms O'Daniel.  Defendant Alma B Mendez-Michel in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Interpreter Vicki Bermudez appears on behalf of defendants .   Interpreters Elke Luken and Rick Kissell also appear and are alternating with Ms Bermudez in providing interpreter services for both defendants.   Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Per prosecutor, Mr Cafferty has a conflict with representing defendant.  Mr Cafferty moves to withdraw.  Mr Keller is willing to substitute in as sponsor for Ms O'Daniel.  Mr Keller appears by speaker phone.  BTC: Withdrawal of Mr Cafferty granted; Mr Keller to substitute in.  


Defense motion to dismiss.   Ms O'Daniel argues on behalf of Ms Mendez-Michel.  State indicates that defendant Rivas made comments to officers that were not recorded while he was enroute from RPD to Racine County jail. 
Investigator Don Nuttall sworn and testifies.  Questioning by the Court.  Direct examination by Ms O'Daniel.   Cross examination by Ms Riek.  Argument.
Investigator Juan Garcia sworn and testifies.  Questioning by the Court.  Direct examination by Ms O'Daniel and Mr Cabranes.  Cross examination by Ms Riek.  Re-direct by Ms O'Daniel.  Re-cross by Ms Riek.  No further argument.  
Defense motions to disclose identity of confidential informant.  Argument.  
Regarding Ms Mendez-Michel:  adequate showing has been made for Court to conduct in-camera review of CI debriefs regarding this transaction (planning, arrangements and actual interactions on Oct 13.  Inv Nuttall will also make himself available to the Court, which may also include meeting with CIs.  The Court withholds ruling until in-camera completed.  State indicates there may not be any reports or debriefings of CIs.  
In recess until 1:50 p.m.
Back on record 2:17 p.m.
Defense is requesting Court review video of original traffic stop.  Court will view in open court.
Investigator Juan Garcia sworn and testifies.  Direct examination by Ms Riek.  
Alberto Aguilar is sworn as interpreter for defendants.
Direct examination continues.  State moves exhibits 1 and 2 into the record.  Received by the Court.
Rulings from  motion hearings heard earlier today  are incorporated into this motion hearing by the Court.  
Cross examination by Ms O'Daniel.  


New dates scheduled for continued motions.
Motion hearing on June 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on May 5, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
from State/defense motion for CI
of attorney John A. Cabranes in support of defendant's motion for disclosure of cofidential informant

Defendant Alma B Mendez-Michel in court with attorney Catherine O'Daniel. Defendant Pablo Rivas in court with attorney John Alexander Cabranes  Defendant Alma B Mendez-Michel and Pablo Rivas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Certified Spanish interpreters appear for defendants and are sworn by the Court. Parties give statements/argument to the Court. Defense indicates that they do not have any of the reports or other information that address the statement Ms. Riek just made to the Court. There is no documentation of the information Ms. Riek has given the Court. BTC: Ms. Riek and Inv. Nuttall are to give the information she has spoken of to the Court. Back on the record 10:33 am. Parties have taken approx 60 minutes to discuss discovery issues. The State has now informed defense of the information that she had, defense had opportunity to question Inv. Nuttall as well. The State indicates an essential witness was inadvertently released. Defense indicates that Inv. Nuttall informed the State of these matters in November, 2015. Defense indicates that there are other motions that they need to file. Defense parties intend to file an Outlaw motion. Defense can have the motion filed w/in 2 weeks.

Mr. Cabranes asks the Court to review bail for Mr. Rivas. The State strenuously objects. 

BTC: Defense Outlaw motion to be filed by February 13, The State has one week to respond. The Court will conduct an in camera review of the information. Bond modification is denied. 
         Ms. Riek will provide the K9 handlers records to defense.

Finding of good cause to waive time limits.n court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Pablo  Rivas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Interpreter, Rick Kissell, appeared on behalf of the defendant.

BTC: Adjournment granted. Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

***AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT ATTACHED***
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant, ABMM.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
